name: Netherlands – Dutch
description: Direct, honest, low-context culture. Values clarity, equality and practicality. Allergic to exaggerated marketing claims.

values_json.formality: informal in most B2C, more formal in B2B

examples_json.bad_marketing: Overpromising, loud American-style hype, unrealistic claims.
examples_json.good_marketing: Straight-to-the-point offers, clear pricing, simple benefits.
examples_json.tone_advice: Speak like a smart but down-to-earth friend.

name: Saudi Arabia – Arabic (KSA)
description: Relationship-based, high-context culture. Values respect, family, tradition and religion. Marketing must be tasteful and aligned with local values.

examples_json.bad_marketing: Sexualized imagery, disrespecting traditions, mocking religion.
examples_json.good_marketing: Messages about family, community, pride, and trust.
examples_json.tone_advice: Respectful, warm, inspiring, with care for community.

name: Japan – Japanese
description: Polite, harmony-oriented, high-context culture. Indirect feedback, strong focus on quality and detail.

examples_json.bad_marketing: Aggressive calls-to-action, hard sales, rude jokes.
examples_json.good_marketing: Calm explanations, subtle persuasion, focus on quality and harmony.

name: United States – English
description: Individualistic, low-context, opportunity-driven culture. Comfortable with direct marketing and strong calls-to-action.

values_json.humor: varied, including sarcasm and bold jokes depending on audience

name: France – French
description: Appreciates elegance, nuance and intellectual depth. Sensitive to linguistic quality.

examples_json.bad_marketing: Sloppy French, too much English, generic corporate buzzwords.
examples_json.good_marketing: Well-written copy, cultural references, sense of style.
examples_json.tone_advice: Elegant, precise, with a touch of sophistication.
